segments.text: South Korea's semiconductor market is gearing up for significant expansion, with growth drivers pushing forecasts to 2034.
This powerhouse region will continue influencing global tech supply chains, especially with surging demand for advanced memory and logic chips.
Meanwhile, investors face a critical choice between semiconductor titans Taiwan Semiconductor (TSMC) and Broadcom.
Both companies are battling for dominance in high-performance computing and AI chip manufacturing, crucial for future tech innovation.
This industry acceleration is underscored by the Electronic Design Automation (EDA) market, projected to hit a staggering US$35.3 billion.
This massive growth in EDA tools is vital, enabling the complex design and verification of all next-generation integrated circuits.
